document_data.caption: The Molten Throne.
document_data.name: ''Molten Throne''
document_data.mainbody: The '''''Molten Throne''''' was a magic throne used by [[Nar-Aidiya]] within [[Krak al-Mazhar]]â€”the secret fortress of the [[Brotherhood of the True Flame]].{{Cite dragon/268/Secrets of the Brotherhood of the True Flame}}
document_data.Description:
The Throne sat upon a stone column in the [[Infernal Hall]] that measured 10 feet in diameter and usually sat 10 feet above the ground. The height of the column could be altered at any time by a mere thought from the Throne's occupant. The column could also rotate a full 360 degrees by using basalt studs found on the throne's arms. A blazing moat filled with ever-burning ''[[wall of fire|walls of fire]]'' surrounded the base of the column.

The Throne itself was a translucent pillar of flame that appeared to be frozen in time.
document_data.History: The ''Molten Throne'' was created by a [[Tasked genie|tasked]] [[artist genie]] at the request of the Sultan of the Efreet, [[Marrake al-Sidan al-Hariq ben Lazan]], to given as a gift to [[Nar-Aidiya]].
document_data.Powers:
Whoever was seated upon the Throne was completely immune to all forms of fire. The occupant could cast ''[[ESP]]'', ''[[chastise]]'', and ''[[flame of justice]]'' at will. Once per day the Throne could be used as a ''[[rod of rulership]]'', forcing the occupant's will upon their servants.

Anyone sitting on the ''Molten Throne'' who was not a member of the Brotherhood of the True Flame was instantly blasted by a powerful ''[[flame strike]]''.

Every time the Throne's occupant used one of the powers there was a small cumulative chance that anyone who was not a committed worshiper of [[Kossuth]] would be turned to worship him, also turning them toward sinister behavior.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: It was believed that the ''Molten Throne'' could only be destroyed if attacked by the whirlwinds of 1,000 [[djinn]].
